Ingredients.2: 0.5 pounds boneless, skinless chicken thighs, cooked

Ingredients.3: 2 cups shredded Monterey Jack cheese, divided

Ingredients.6: 2 (4 ounce) cans mild chopped green chile peppers

Ingredients.7: 1 bunch green onions, trimmed and cut into 3-inch lengths

Ingredients.11: 1 salt and ground black pepper to taste

Directions.1: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Spray a 9x13-inch baking dish with cooking spray.

Directions.2: Chop cooked chicken thighs into small pieces and place in a medium mixing bowl. Stir 1/2 cup Monterey Jack cheese and chili powder into the chicken.

Directions.3: Combine tomatillos, chile peppers, green onions, cilantro, jalapeno, and garlic in the bowl of a food processor. Process until pureed, about 3 minutes. Add chicken broth and pulse to mix. Season with salt and pepper.

Directions.4: Cut tortillas in half and place directly on the hot oven racks. Heat for 2 to 3 minutes. Carefully remove tortillas and set aside.

Directions.5: Place 1 cup of the green sauce on the bottom of the prepared baking dish. Layer 1/2 of the tortillas over the sauce. Add 1/2 of the chicken mixture. Spoon 1/2 of the remaining green sauce over the chicken, then sprinkle on 1/2 of the remaining cheese. Repeat the layers of tortillas, chicken mixture, green sauce, and cheese.

Directions.6: Bake in the preheated oven until the cheese is melted and the sauce is bubbly, about 20 minutes.
